title: Calderdale Way Walking Route

images.title: John Illingworth / Calderdale Way
images.caption: A footbridge over a pretty stream and waterfall on the Calderdale Way at the edge of Warley Moor near Wainstalls.

images.title: Phil Markham / Wainstalls, on the Calderdale Way
images.caption: Looking across the valley above Booth to Wainstalls from the edge of Midgley Moor.

images.title: Phil Markham / The Long Stoop, on the Calderdale Way
images.caption: The Long Stoop, on the Calderdale Way. An ancient guidepost across the moors and a crossing point of the Calderdale and Pennine Ways.

images.title: Phil Markham / Millbank from the Calderdale Way
images.caption: Descending between Soyland and Millbank.

images.title: Bill Boaden / Bridge on the Calderdale Way
images.caption: Old Stone Bridge on the trail. This also shows the hillside up to Whirlaw Stones.

images.title: Phil Markham / Long Lees Lock, On Calderdale Way
images.caption: Long Lees Lock. Stretch of the Calder and Hebble canal between Brighouse and Salterhebble

images.title: Phil Markham / Above North Dean Wood, on Calderdale Way
images.caption: Heading to Norland above North Dean Wood.

images.title: Phil Markham / Withens and Ovenden Moor Windfarm, from Calderdale Way
images.caption: Withens and Ovenden Moor Windfarm, from Calderdale Way. At Moor Bottom between Saltonstall and Hunter Hill looking towards the southern edge of the 23 wind turbines at Ovenden Moor.

description: The Calderdale Way is a walking circuit around the beautiful district of Calderdale in West Yorkshire. The walk passes through exposed moorland and woodland paths, while there are also waterside sections along the Rochdale Canal , the River Calder and around Withens Clough Reservoir and Warlands Reservoir. The walk officially starts at Greetland and passes through Ripponden , Mankinholes, Todmorden, Heptonstall , Holdsworth, Shelf and Brighouse. Highlights on the route include the beautiful wooded valley at Hardcastle Crags and the attractive heathland on Norland Moor near Sowerby Bridge.
